etymology.description: 〇 (top edge of a 鼎(dǐng, "ding")) indicating roundness -> round object -> member
etymology.interpretation: The character 員(員) (yuán, "member") originally depicts the top edge of a 鼎(鼎) (dǐng, "cauldron"), highlighting roundness. Over time, it came to denote a "member" as in a group, signifying a unit within a larger structured whole.
etymology.simplification: 员(員): 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") was simplified to 贝(貝), reducing strokes while keeping the phonetic 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth").

examples.chinese: 公司重视每一位员工(公司重視每一位員工)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī zhòngshì měi yī wèi yuángōng.

examples.chinese: 他是团队的核心成员(他是團隊的核心成員)，总是提出好点子(總是提出好點子)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì tuánduì de héxīn chéngyuán, zǒng shì tíchū hǎo diǎnzi.
examples.english: He is a core member of the team and always comes up with good ideas.

examples.chinese: 俱乐部新录取了一位优秀的会员(俱樂部新錄取了一位優秀的會員)。
examples.pinyin: Jùlèbù xīn lùqǔ le yī wèi yōuxiù de huìyuán.
examples.english: The club has newly admitted an outstanding member.
